learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the principles of ergonomics, and its relevance to creating a healthy and safe workplace.

Apply principles of anthropometry to design safe, equitable and inclusive workplaces, ensuring that physical workspace elements accommodate diverse populations safely and promote fairness in employment practices.
Anticipate, identify and analyse risks in the workplace that may lead to the onset of musculoskeletal disorders.
Determine evidence based strategies for the prevention of work-related musculo-skeletal disorders.

Critically evaluate existing work environments, identify areas for improvement, and apply innovative ideas and practices to enhance the design of work and work environments, resulting in increased productivity, employee satisfaction, and overall organizational effectiveness.

Effectively communicate to key stakeholders the benefits of applying ergonomic principles to the design of work and working environments in order to enhance safety and productivity in various occupational settings.

assessments.mode: Activity/ Performance, Oral, Product/ Artefact/ Multimedia
assessments.category: Creative Production/ Exhibition, Participation/ Student contribution, Practical/ Demonstration, Presentation, Role play/ Simulation
assessments.task_description:
Students must participate in ALL scheduled workshops, but FOUR set workshop activities will be graded:

  • Activity A: Why can't I work the remote
  • Activity B: I like that!
  • Activity C: The burger challenge
  • Activity D: Office design challenge


All students who participate in the graded activity will gain a minimum of 3/5.

If students are absent for medical reasons they will need to liaise directly with the course coordinator to arrange alternative assessment.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

Students are welcome to use AI in an appropriate manner. But a grade of 1/5 will be used where students fully undertook the activity using AI and there is no evidence of actual interaction.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to present outcomes of activities during class time.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 1: Introduction to Ergonomics - ONLINE LEARNING

Students are to independently complete the following online modules accessible via the Blackboard page prior to attendance at the first contact session:

  • Unit 1: Ergonomics and Anthropometry
  • Unit 2: Human Centred Design

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 1: Introduction to Ergonomics - ONLINE LEARNING Students are to independently complete the following online modules accessible via the Blackboard page prior to attendance at the first contact session: Unit 1: Ergonomics and Anthropometry Unit 2: Human Centred Design

learning_activities.topic:
Module 2: Anthropometry

Workshop: Why can't i reach that?


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 2: Anthropometry Workshop: Why can't i reach that?

learning_activities.topic:
Module 3: Human variability - Cognition

Over a series of lectures and workshops students will develop knowledge and skills around human cognition.


Learning outcomes: L01, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 3: Human variability - Cognition Over a series of lectures and workshops students will develop knowledge and skills around human cognition.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 4: Human Centred Design

Students will explore good examples of human centred design


Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 4: Human Centred Design Students will explore good examples of human centred design

learning_activities.topic:
Module 5: Human Variability - Psychosocial aspects of work

Review of the impact of psycho-social hazards on the development of musculo-skeletal disorders, and consideration of "good work design".


Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Module 5: Human Variability - Psychosocial aspects of work
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 5: Human Variability - Psychosocial aspects of work Review of the impact of psycho-social hazards on the development of musculo-skeletal disorders, and consideration of "good work design".

learning_activities.topic:
Module 6: Ergonomics for MSD Prevention: Slips, trips and falls

A review of the mechanisms of slips and trips in the workplace, including measurement techniques and preventative strategies.


Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_title: Module 6: Ergonomics for MSD Prevention: Slips, trips and falls
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 6: Ergonomics for MSD Prevention: Slips, trips and falls A review of the mechanisms of slips and trips in the workplace, including measurement techniques and preventative strategies.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 7: Physically demanding work - ONLINE LEARNING

Students are to independently complete the following online modules accessible via the Blackboard page prior to attendance at the second contact weekend:

  • Unit 3: Physically demanding work
  • Unit 4: Ergonomics for MDS prevention: The Office


Learning outcomes: L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 7: Physically demanding work - ONLINE LEARNING Students are to independently complete the following online modules accessible via the Blackboard page prior to attendance at the second contact weekend: Unit 3: Physically demanding work Unit 4: Ergonomics for MDS prevention: The Office

learning_activities.topic:
Module 7: Physically demanding work

Over a series of lectures and workshops students will develop knowledge around the impact of physically demanding work and will develop skills to assesses physically demanding tasks in the workplace.


Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 7: Physically demanding work Over a series of lectures and workshops students will develop knowledge around the impact of physically demanding work and will develop skills to assesses physically demanding tasks in the workplace.

learning_activities.topic:

Students will be presented with the current evidence base for MSD prevention in physically demanding work.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04, L05, L06
